a:5:{s:1:"d";a:10:{i:0;O:8:"stdClass":15:{s:11:"category_id";s:3:"236";s:13:"category_type";s:10:"categories";s:9:"parent_id";s:1:"0";s:3:"uri";s:51:"regional-knowledge-centre-for-marine-plastic-debris";s:13:"category_name";s:51:"Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris";s:11:"description";s:1288:"<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
</head>
<body>
<p>Various documents emphasising the importance of sharing knowledge and capacity development related to marine plastic debris have been produced by the United Nations, the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), and others. One of them is the ASEAN+3 Marine Plastics Debris Cooperative Action Initiative, which states best use of existing institutions such as Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), for sharing knowledge and capacity development. The initiative was welcomed by the ASEAN+3 Summit (10 ASEAN Member States, China, Japan, and Republic of Korea) in November 2018.&nbsp;With support from the Government of Japan and others, ERIA established on 01 October 2019 the Regional Knowledge Center for Marine Plastic Debris (RKC-MPD), an information clearinghouse on marine plastic debris in ASEAN+3 countries.</p>
<p><a class="bluebtn" title="Click here to go to the Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris website" href="https://rkcmpd-eria.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Visit the RKC-MPD website</a></p>
<p><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QY1sBaTgd-0" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p>
</body>
</html>";s:13:"external_link";s:1:"0";s:10:"image_name";s:75:"/uploads/categories/regional-knowledge-center-for-marine-plastic-debris.jpg";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:8:"order_id";s:2:"20";s:13:"meta_keywords";s:97:"Regional Knowledge Centre on Marine Plastic Debris, marine plastic debris, marine litter, ASEAN+3";s:16:"meta_description";s:158:"ERIA established the Regional Knowledge Center for Marine Plastic Debris (RKC-MPD), an information clearinghouse on marine plastic debris in ASEAN+3 countries";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-02-28 06:44:59";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"1";s:7:"old_url";N;}i:1;O:8:"stdClass":15:{s:11:"category_id";s:3:"229";s:13:"category_type";s:10:"categories";s:9:"parent_id";s:1:"0";s:3:"uri";s:15:"healthcare-unit";s:13:"category_name";s:15:"Healthcare Unit";s:11:"description";s:2049:"<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
</head>
<body>
<p>ERIA&rsquo;s Healthcare Unit recommends health policy to the Governments of 16 East Asia Summit countries based on significant best practices throughout the region in response to the demographic shift by engaging in collaborative ageing studies and conferences in Asia. By 2050, the number of people in Asia who are aged 65 or older is expected to grow to 937 million &ndash; more than double today&rsquo;s number. Further, as many of ERIA&rsquo;s Member States continue to transform from low- and middle-income countries and on top of these, mental health disorders. Thus, the Healthcare Unit is now expanding the evidence-base for these critical specialities, including neglected diseases, through an international regional clinical trials research network which includes training and development of researchers who can achieve quality standards while respecting the diversity of all cultures.</p>
<p>Click one of the buttons below to&nbsp;be redirected to the AHWIN website, read news from the Healthcare Unit, or download the publications for free.</p>
<p><a class="bluebtn" title="Asia Health and Wellbeing Initiative" href="https://www.ahwin.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Asia Health and Wellbeing Initiative</a></p>
<p><a class="bluebtn" title="Medical Excellence JAPAN" href="https://medicalexcellencejapan.org/en/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Medical Excellence JAPAN</a></p>
<p><a class="bluebtn" title="Click here to read and download the publications" href="https://test-www-eria-org.azurewebsites.net/research/topic/healthcare-and-ageing-society" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Publications under the category 'Healthcare and Ageing Society'</a></p>
<p><a class="bluebtn" title="Longitudinal Survey" href="https://test-www-eria-org.azurewebsites.net/database-and-programmes/longitudinal-study-of-ageing-and-health-in-the-philippines-and-viet-nam/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Longitudinal Survey</a></p>
</body>
</html>";s:13:"external_link";s:1:"0";s:10:"image_name";s:34:"/uploads/categories/healthcare.png";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:8:"order_id";s:2:"30";s:13:"meta_keywords";s:135:"ageing, Japan, Asia, health, wellbeing, Asia Health and Wellbeing Initiative, ERIA, healthcare, Japan Center for International Exchange";s:16:"meta_description";s:127:"ERIA and Japan Center for International Exchange launched a new website to disseminate key data and resources on ageing in Asia";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-02-28 06:38:33";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"1";s:7:"old_url";N;}i:2;O:8:"stdClass":15:{s:11:"category_id";s:3:"259";s:13:"category_type";s:10:"categories";s:9:"parent_id";s:1:"0";s:3:"uri";s:26:"medical-excellence-in-asia";s:13:"category_name";s:26:"Medical Excellence in Asia";s:11:"description";s:672:"<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
</head>
<body>
<p>MEXX aims to create a society where all people in Asia achieve the highest possible level of health and &nbsp;longevity through collaborative efforts on a bilateral basis under global health context and expansion of business opportunities for the medical and healthcare industry by referencing industry-government-academia collaboration model by Japan and gathering the knowledge and wisdom in the region. The final goal is for each MEXX platform to have more interactive &nbsp;dialogues, autonomously and continuously, aimed at achieving an equalised and seamless medical ecosystem in the region.</p>
</body>
</html>";s:13:"external_link";s:1:"0";s:10:"image_name";s:40:"/uploads/categories/istock-483789748.jpg";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:8:"order_id";s:2:"40";s:13:"meta_keywords";s:0:"";s:16:"meta_description";s:0:"";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-02-23 03:57:06";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"16";s:7:"old_url";N;}i:3;O:8:"stdClass":15:{s:11:"category_id";s:2:"36";s:13:"category_type";s:10:"categories";s:9:"parent_id";s:1:"0";s:3:"uri";s:27:"capacity-building-programme";s:13:"category_name";s:27:"Capacity Building Programme";s:11:"description";s:373:"<p>As a leading think tank conducting quality research on numerous issues, and with its strong relations with governments in the region, ERIA is well positioned to implement a robust Capacity Building Programme (CBP). Focusing on Cambodia, Lao PDR, Myanmar and Viet Nam (the &#039;CLMV&#039; states), the CBP bridges the gap between research and national policy-making.</p>";s:13:"external_link";s:1:"0";s:10:"image_name";s:41:"/uploads/categories/capacity-building.jpg";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:8:"order_id";s:2:"50";s:13:"meta_keywords";s:0:"";s:16:"meta_description";s:0:"";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-07-08 16:42:20";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"4";s:7:"old_url";N;}i:4;O:8:"stdClass":15:{s:11:"category_id";s:2:"37";s:13:"category_type";s:10:"categories";s:9:"parent_id";s:1:"0";s:3:"uri";s:28:"asean-east-asia-ntm-database";s:13:"category_name";s:28:"ASEAN/East Asia NTM Database";s:11:"description";s:2531:"<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
</head>
<body>
<p>ERIA, in collaboration with the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD), collected and classified non-tariff measures (NTMs) in the ten ASEAN countries (Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Lao PDR, Malaysia, Myanmar, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and Viet Nam). Both organisations worked on all regulations and official documents including international conventions adopted by countries which were in effect as of March 2018.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Data collection consists of two phases: The first database released in January 2016, and the updated database completed in early 2019. Both phases are accompanied by analytical reports.</p>
<p>The project aims to (i) collect, validate, and store NTM data from official sources; (ii) improve the general understanding of these measures and their impact on world trade; <em>and</em> (iii) provide insights on NTMs in&nbsp;ten countries.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Click the button below to access the NTM database in an external site.&nbsp;</p>
<p><a class="bluebtn" title="TRAINS: the global database on Non-Tariff Measures" href="https://trains.unctad.org/Default.aspx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">TRAINS: the global database on Non-Tariff Measures</a></p>

participation.&#039;</p><h2>&nbsp;</h2>";s:13:"external_link";s:1:"0";s:10:"image_name";s:59:"/uploads/categories/comprehensive-asia-development-plan.jpg";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:8:"order_id";s:2:"70";s:13:"meta_keywords";s:103:"CADP, Comprehensive Asia Development Plan (CADP), in response to a request from the leaders of EAS";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-07-08 16:42:37";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"4";s:7:"old_url";N;}i:6;O:8:"stdClass":15:{s:11:"category_id";s:3:"239";s:13:"category_type";s:10:"categories";s:9:"parent_id";s:1:"0";s:3:"uri";s:8:"covid-19";s:13:"category_name";s:8:"COVID-19";s:11:"description";s:147:"<p><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_Ek8MI04y2Q" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p>";s:13:"external_link";s:1:"0";s:10:"image_name";s:49:"/uploads/categories/istock-1212767605-665x270.jpg";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:8:"order_id";s:2:"80";s:13:"meta_keywords";s:0:"";s:16:"meta_description";s:0:"";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-07-08 09:48:46";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"4";s:7:"old_url";N;}i:7;O:8:"stdClass":15:{s:11:"category_id";s:3:"256";s:13:"category_type";s:10:"categories";s:9:"parent_id";s:1:"0";s:3:"uri";s:17:"asia-ccus-network";s:13:"category_name";s:17:"Asia CCUS Network";s:11:"description";s:1666:"<p>The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) and the East Asia Summit (EAS) region are facing tremendous challenges regarding the future energy landscape and how the energy transition will embrace a new architecture &ndash; including sound policies and technologies to ensure energy access with affordability, energy security, and energy sustainability. Given the high share of fossil fuels in the current energy mix of ASEAN and EAS (oil, coal, and natural gas make up almost 80% of the primary energy mix for both the ASEAN and EAS region), the clean use of fossil fuels through the deployment of clean technologies is indispensable for decarbonising emissions in ASEAN and the EAS region. The future energy transition of ASEAN and the EAS region will rely on today&rsquo;s actions, policies, and investments to change the fossil fuel-based energy system towards a cleaner energy system. But any decisions and energy policy measures to be rolled out during the energy transition need to be weighed against potentially higher energy costs, affordability issues, and energy security risks. The continued use of fossil fuel to steer economic growth in ASEAN and the EAS region will require appropriate technologies to use fossil fuels in responsible and environmentally friendly ways through clean technologies such as clean coal technology and carbon capture, utilisation, and storage (CCUS), to decarbonise the region&rsquo;s emission in the foreseeable future.</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="Visit the Asia CCUS Network website" href="http://asiaccusnetwork-eria.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Visit the Asia CCUS Network website</a></p>";s:13:"external_link";s:1:"0";s:10:"image_name";s:49:"/uploads/categories/istock-1182779865_665x270.jpg";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:8:"order_id";s:2:"90";s:13:"meta_keywords";s:40:"carbon capture, utilisation, and storage";s:16:"meta_description";s:40:"carbon capture, utilisation, and storage";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-07-11 16:42:11";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"4";s:7:"old_url";N;}i:8;O:8:"stdClass":15:{s:11:"category_id";s:3:"284";s:13:"category_type";s:10:"categories";s:9:"parent_id";s:1:"0";s:3:"uri";s:18:"asean-chairmanship";s:13:"category_name";s:18:"ASEAN Chairmanship";s:11:"description";s:730:"<div>ERIA provides support to&nbsp;<span class="il">ASEAN</span>&nbsp;Chairs by working closely with them on the design and delivery of priority economic deliverables (PEDs).</div><div>&nbsp;</div><div>In 2023, ERIA supports Indonesia as&nbsp;<span class="il">Chair</span>&nbsp;of&nbsp;<span class="il">ASEAN</span>&nbsp;on the following priorities:</div><div>&nbsp;</div><div><p>Coordinator: Dr Aladdin Rillo</p><ol type="1"><li>Trade, Industry, Investment, and Digital Transformation: Dr. Lili Yan Ing</li><li>Energy Transition: Dr Han Phoumin and Dr Joko Purwanto &nbsp;&nbsp;</li><li>Fiscal and Infrastructure: Dr Fauziah Zen</li><li>NTMs and Trade Facilitation: Dr Doan Ha and Mr Salvador</li><li>Blue Economy</li></ol></div>";s:13:"external_link";s:1:"0";s:10:"image_name";s:61:"/uploads/categories/asean-for-indonesia-2023-logo-665x270.jpg";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:8:"order_id";s:2:"91";s:13:"meta_keywords";s:18:"ASEAN Chairmanship";s:16:"meta_description";s:18:"ASEAN Chairmanship";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-03-14 15:44:16";s:11:"modified_by";N;s:7:"old_url";N;}i:9;O:8:"stdClass":15:{s:11:"category_id";s:3:"275";s:13:"category_type";s:10:"categories";s:9:"parent_id";s:1:"0";s:3:"uri";s:59:"organisation-for-economic-co-operation-and-development-oecd";s:13:"category_name";s:61:"Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)";s:11:"description";s:1374:"<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
</head>
<body>
<p>The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) is an organisation with a mission to promote policies that will improve the economic and social well-being of people around the world. It has a headquarter in Paris and several regional centres&nbsp;around the world:&nbsp;<strong><span class="more"><a href="http://www.oecd.org/berlin/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Berlin</a>,&nbsp;</span><span class="more"><a title="Home &raquo; OECD.org &raquo; Satellite Sites &raquo; Centro de M&eacute;xico" href="http://www.oecd.org/centrodemexico/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Mexico City</a>,&nbsp;</span><span class="more"><a href="http://www.oecd.org/tokyo/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Tokyo</a>, and&nbsp;</span><a href="http://www.oecd.org/washington/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Washington, DC</a></strong></p>
<p>In 2014, ERIA and OECD signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to share&nbsp;their knowledge and experiences in the development of the Southeast Asia region, and conduct joint projects, symposia, and workshops at a regional level. This MoU has been extended twice in 2017 and 2021, which further cemented the strong partnership between the organisations and resulted in various publications and seminars.&nbsp;</p>
</body>
</html>";s:13:"external_link";s:1:"0";s:10:"image_name";s:33:"/uploads/categories/oecd-logo.jpg";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:13:"meta_keywords";s:0:"";s:16:"meta_description";s:0:"";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-02-28 06:45:14";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"1";s:7:"old_url";N;}}s:1:"g";a:0:{}s:1:"e";O:8:"DateTime":3:{s:4:"date";s:26:"2023-05-22 12:12:57.171368";s:13:"timezone_type";i:3;s:8:"timezone";s:13:"Europe/Berlin";}s:1:"m";N;s:1:"c";N;}
